page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: THE AREA IS MAINLY SET IN THE RADNOR FOREST WHERE HILLS TOP 2000 FEET AND VALLEYS (NO LOWER THAN 700 FEET) ARE WATERED BY MANY STREAMS. ONE HILL, THE{WHIMBLE,}WITH ITS STEEPLY DOMED TOP DOMINATES THE VIEW FOR MILES AROUND. THE HIGHER GROUND OF THE FOREST IS TREELESS AND COVERED ONLY WITH HEATHER AND WHINBERRIES AND ROCKY OUTCROPS. ON LOWER GROUND INDIGENOUS TREES GROW - THE ASH, ROWAN, SCRUB OAK, ELDER AND THORN. ABOUT ONE-TWELFTH OF THE AREA IS COVERED WITH FORESTRY COMMISSION CONIFERS OF ABOUT THIRTY YEARS GROWTH. WELL USED PUBLIC FOOTPATHS AND BRIDLEWAYS PENETRATE THE FOREST. ON THE NORTHERN EXTREMITIES ARE CONSERVATION AREAS DESIGNATED FOR THEIR RARE PLANTS.
